Articles.Content:
Yeah, and they bring us a smartphone. It warms the heart of every old school geek out there.

[http://www.wired.com/2015/07/commodore-smartphone/](http://www.wired.com/2015/07/commodore-smartphone/)

![commodore-2-1024x683.jpg](http://www.wired.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/07/commodore-2-1024x683.jpg)
Thought that you were talking about a Holden haha. In any case neat.
Sweet I hope all the icons are sprites.
I hope it takes 30 minutes to switch on.

When you first turn it on, the screen is constantly scrolling off the top until you turn the adjustment nob. Then after about 10 minutes when the device heats up, you have to turn the nob the other direction to keep the picture from scrolling off the bottom.
It comes with a cassette tape drive. If you want a 5-1/4" floppy disk drive that will cost you $300 extra.
Comes with interpreter and serial port right?
